sentences.sContent: England—Like a porcelain figurine carved into repose, the fetus of a foal floats in a jar.
sentences.sContent_eng: England—Like a porcelain figurine carved into repose, the fetus of a foal floats in a jar.
sentences.sCn: 英国——马的胚胎像是一个沉睡的瓷制雕像，浮在广口瓶中。

sentences.sContent: The angel figurine reminded me of the white elephant gift exchange game that we play every year.
sentences.sContent_eng: The angel figurine reminded me of the white elephant gift exchange game that we play every year.
sentences.sCn: 天使小雕像使我想起了我们每年都会玩的“白象礼物交换游戏”；

remMethod.val: figur(雕像) + ine(小的) → 小雕像

trans.tranOther: a small model of a person or animal used as a decoration
